llm_reply: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), antiviral medications such as oseltamivir (Tamiflu) and zanamivir (Relenza) are recommended for treating influenza A and B, while other viral infections like the common cold or respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) may require antibiotic treatment for secondary bacterial infections.
